What is the main difference between `Array.prototype.map()` and `Array.prototype.forEach()`?
answer_1: `forEach()` returns a new array, `map()` modifies the original array.
answer_2: `map()` returns a new array with the results of calling a function for every array element, while `forEach()` does not return a new array.
answer_3: There is no difference, they are interchangeable.
answer_4: `map()` can only be used on arrays of numbers, `forEach()` can be used on any array.
right_answer: `map()` returns a new array with the results of calling a function for every array element, while `forEach()` does not return a new array.

title: In CSS, which of the following selectors has the highest specificity?
What is the difference between the `async` and `defer` attributes on a `<script>` tag?
answer_1: `async` scripts are executed in order, while `defer` scripts are not.
answer_2: `defer` guarantees script execution order, `async` does not. Both download without blocking HTML parsing.
right_answer: `defer` guarantees script execution order, `async` does not. Both download without blocking HTML parsing.

title: What is a closure in JavaScript?
answer_1: A way to close a web browser window using code.
answer_2: A function having access to the global scope.
answer_3: A combination of a function and the lexical environment within which that function was declared.
answer_4: A built-in method to stop script execution.
right_answer: A combination of a function and the lexical environment within which that function was declared.
